review: If you already have plenty invested in Apple or iTunes, it's great. However, iTunes Match can lag, which, if you have 3rd gen is really the easiest way to stream your library. That used to just be a free feature remember. It forgets artwork and doesn't necessarily always have all your tracks. Throw in the fact that sometimes AirPlay works for some video and not for others and you have a product that fails to deliver on all it's promises. I make very little money so it took a long time to get this little black box. I'm really disappointed in it's inconsistency and connection/recognition issues. Also, Hbo go is not supported for Apple TV in all areas, which I was not aware of until well after the purchase. So I still have to leave my old Roku plugged in. The picture, command speed and audio are all exceptional though, so it's not a total bummer. And...most importantly I finally have a remote I can safely fit up my ass. So I've got that going for me. The iTunes rental access is of course, excellent and always at the top of your menu.
author: Joe Dawson
